resources.string: Jetpack Compose Showcase

`Layouts` in Jetpack Compose (e.g. `Column`, `Row`, `Box`, etc.) are used to arrange and organize other UI elements. They help control the positioning and alignment of components.
The `Navigation Rail` is a vertical navigation widget used for presenting navigation options, typically positioned along the screen edge.
The `AppBar` is a customizable top app bar or bottom app bar that typically contains navigation and actions for the current screen. It\'s a common element in Android app UIs.

`Animations` in Jetpack compose are dynamic visual effects that bring your user interface to life. With built in support for creating smooth and interactive animations, you can add motion, transitions, and delightful user experiences to your app\'s Ul effortlessly.
A `Dialog` is a pop-up window that can display critical information, confirmations, or additional options without navigating to a new screen.
The `DatePicker` widget allows users to select a date from a calendar-like interface, making it useful for date-related input tasks.
`Tabs` organize content into sections, allowing users to switch between different views or categories.
A `Card` is a container that groups related content together. It often has a shadow and elevation to create a visually distinct surface for displaying information.
`Progress Bars` indicate the status of ongoing tasks or loading processes, providing visual feedback to users.
`Sliders` allow users to select a value within a range. They\'re often used for settings or adjusting parameters.
A `Snackbar` is a brief, informative message that appears at the bottom of the screen, often used to provide feedback or notifications to the user.
A `BottomSheet` is a component that slides in from the bottom of the screen to display additional content or options, making efficient use of screen space.
The `Text` widget is used for displaying static text in your user interface. It\'s commonly used for headings, labels, and paragraphs.
A `Button` is a clickable UI element that triggers actions when pressed. It\'s essential for user interactions like submitting forms or initiating processes.
The `TextField` widget allows users to input text. It\'s used for various purposes, such as entering usernames, passwords, or search queries.

`Image` is a fundamental Jetpack compose component used to display images within your app\'s user interface. It allows you to effortlessly incorporate visuals, such as icons, pictures, or graphics, into your app\'s layout, enhancing its visual appeal and user experience.
A `Pager` is a UI component that enables the creation of horizontally or vertically swipeable pages, commonly used for onboarding screens, image galleries, and more.
`Badges` are small, circular Ul elements used to provide additional context or information about an item, like notifications or counts.
`Tooltips` display additional information when users interact with specific UI elements, offering helpful hints or descriptions.
`Chips` represent a compact piece of information, often used for tagging, categorization, or selection.
